item.title: Telling quite the tale in the Seven Kingdoms
item.author: James Dutton,
item.description: Telltale Games have put their name to another TV franchise and this time round it is the giant that is Game of Thrones. For those not familiar with the Telltale style, the game is a combination of point-and-click and quick-time events. Those wishing to run about Westeros as Benjen Stark/Daario …

item.title: The Observable Universe on your Desk
item.author: James Dutton,
item.description: Have you ever wondered if there is a program that can simulate the whole observable universe (and even beyond)? Well, step forward Space Engine. It has been in the works since 2005 and is the beautiful and complex brainchild of Russian astronomer and programmer Vladimir Romanyuk. The concept of the …

item.title: Millions injured in worst Friday since Rebecca Black
item.author: James Dutton,
item.description: Horror at Currys PC World Workington branch as millions of people flocked to the store to pick up excellent deals on the best and latest technology, ranging from 2.5mm microphone cables to ruby-encrusted vibrators. The opening was just like any day but the first people to arrive were literally …

item.title: Driving the spinning limousine
item.author: James Dutton,
item.description: Your name is Giorgio Manos. Sporting red hair, a light blue suit and white gloves, your profession: limousine driver. You pick up passengers and deliver them to their respective destinations for cash, but there’s a twist… literally. You don’t just drive the way your wheels are pointing (what would …

item.title: Gone Home: A homecoming simulator
item.author: James Dutton,
item.description: After trawling the fairly non-exhaustive ‘Best Games of 2013’ lists, I came across a game which intrigued me – low budget, first-person and heavily story based. Major reviews raved about it, so I took the plunge on ‘_Gone Home_’ – the first effort of The Fullbright Company. You play as Kaitlin …
